    • createGATEDocument

      public static gate.Document createGATEDocument​(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas pJCas, int pLabelOptions)
      createGATEDocument returns a GATE Document from the uima cas.
      Parameters:
      pJCas -
      pLabelOptions - USE_NAMESPACE if you want to have gov.va.chir.model. kind of namespace be part of the gate label) HITEX_CHIR_MAPPINGS maps the CHIR Labels to hitex mappings DONT_USE_NAMESPACE uses only the label without a name space The default is to not use the name space.
      Returns:
      gate.Document

    • convertGateAnnotationsToCAS

    • convertGateAnnotationsToCASObs

      public static void convertGateAnnotationsToCASObs​(gate.Document gateDoc, org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas pJCas)
      Deprecated.
      convertGateAnnotationsToCAS adds gate annotations to the JCAS

    • convertGateAnnotationsToCAS

      public static void convertGateAnnotationsToCAS​(gate.Document gateOutputDoc, org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas pJCas, java.util.List<java.lang.String> newFeatures, int labelOptions, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> pUimaToGateTypeHash)
      convertGateAnnotationsToCAS adds back to the CAS annotations from the gate document, merging and adding features for overlapping annotations. For example, the JCas includes gov.va.chir.model.Phrase, and these are passed into and become the gate document as "Phrase" annotations. The gate process adds a Negation_Status to each Phrase. These phrases are handed back. This method will recognize gov.va.chir.model.Phrase(s) and gate Phrase(s) with the same span are the same - and add the gate Phrase features to the gov.va.chir.model.Phrase features.
      Parameters:
      gateOutputDoc -
      pJCas -
      newFeatures - (List of of the form label:featureName
      labelOptions -
